name: Hotel Pulitzer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked the Pulitzer based on Trip ratings, and while many aspects of the hotel were in fact quite good, there was a couple of things that cause me to rate as only average. To details.
reviews.title: Pulitzer OK - But Poor Housekeeping

likes.disliked: — Stains all over nice stone sink, and on walls

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a superior room, which does in fact have quite a bit more space than a regular room. All rooms are somewhat narrow and long. The nice flat screen TV's are mounted at the end of the bed, but you have to duck around it to access the other side of the bed.
reviews.title: Impressive service
loved the pulitzer
reviews.text: Best part of the Pulitzer is the decor, which is very hip and cool. Our room had great artwork very nicely framed and presented. It also had a great huge sliding door from the room to the bathroom, which had a very modern feel with full natural stone sink, floors and such. A nice leather couch was part of the superior room layout.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only downside was either due to poor selection of stone for the bathroom, or poor cleaning, hard to tell which. Unfortunately the lovely bathroom sink area had round glass stains all over it, and the floor had many water spot stains by the tub. This marred what could have been a true 4 star hotel room. There was also what looked like coffee spill stains on the wall by the bed. This could all have been easily fixed by a coat of paint and buffing of the stone in the bathroom.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby and bar on the ground floor is very nice, with white leather everywhere and a nice feel to the place.
reviews.title: wonderful celebration

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: excellent location,very clean,bathroom supplies superb!There "easy food" served in the comfortable bar-lounge was very good.Will visit again.
reviews.title: location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I was there for 1 night only, as I wanted to see as much of the city as possible, which I was able to do since this hotel is so amazingly located. Clean, modern, friendly staff, with great room deals. Would definitely recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Charming, city-center hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location and great service. Staff was very nice & helpful with suggestions to restaurants nearby. Clean & Comfy Rooms.
reviews.title: Great Find!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: Nice hotel, friendly staff. well decorate.
reviews.title: Hotel centraly located

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: Nice breakfast buffet.
reviews.title: Perfect location Modern stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Have just come back from staying in this hotel and can't imagine a better place to stay in Barcelona if you want a fabulous location,very clean, smart and modern surroundings with friendly staff and great value for money. The rooftop bar is perfect for a night cap, the restaurnet does lovely food and a more than satisfactory breakfast buffet and it is a great place to come back to after the hustle and bustle of the streets of Barcelona. One tip, if you are booking through the hotels website make sure you make it clear what type of room you want. We booked best rate for Queen/Twin and ended up in a twin. The receptionist said we needed to let them know which one we wanted which the website didn't tell us. Probably common sense but check to make sure. Otherwise a fabuous stay will deifnately come back here!
reviews.title: Stylish, welcoming, chic place to stay
Loved it
reviews.text: this hotel is amazing because of their friendly staff the know everything they smile all the time they are helpful and kind

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: what I like in this hotel is the amazing location of it its 3 minute walking to the dirty rambla if u like this place all the shopping area is around us metro too , the room is modern and nice but its very small i can’t walk around it , the lighting system is complicated a lil bit for the first time but with all this features it does not matter
reviews.title: Very nice hotel

likes.liked: — The flat screen in the rooms and the little packs of razors/tooth brush, bathrobe etc nice touch
likes.disliked: — The bar prices and bar staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: note that u have free wi-fi on all the rooms which is amazing
reviews.title: Very central location, but slightly gloomy.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: there is a nice bar terrace
reviews.title: Great Hotel & Perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed four nights at the hotel as tourists and thoroughly enjoyed our visit. It is in a great location just off the Placa Catalonia. Although very central we found the hotel quiet and were not disturbed by noise at all. We ate one meal in the hotel restaurant which was very nice. We found all the hotel amenities very satisfactory and the staff very professional and helpful. We would definately recommed this hotel and would stay there again if we visit Barcelona.
reviews.title: Highly recommended hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I sayed here for 3 nights at the end of our honeymoon. The Hotel was nice and clean and the rooms were spacious. The location of this hotel is perfect. It is located at the top of Las Ramblas and near the stops for Bus Touristic (which is great for sightseeing). The one issue we had with the hotel was the noise. This has been mentioned in other review before but we didn't think we would have a problem with it. On our third morning we were woken up by what sounded like people packing up and leaving. It souded like they were in our room. It is obvious that this hotel does have a slight noise issue. Other than that, it was a great stay.
reviews.title: Great Location for a Fun City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007
reviews.text: I booked the Pulitzer on their Website, after reading the reviews here. It is in a terrific location, on a safe street just steps off the main plaza. We had some minor problems, though. Our first room had non-functioning air conditioning and a dirty toilet. The staff switched us to another room that evening, which had the best shower I've ever experinced in Europe, except that it didn't drain, almost to the point of flooding the bathroom. That was fixed the next day, so the staff did their best for us. We found the stylish recessed spotlights throughout the hotel to be quite dim, especially entering the hotel from the sunny street. We loved Barcelona, and although I'm not sorry we stayed at the Pulitzer, I'd try another hotel next visit.
reviews.title: OK hotel, great location
Absolutely Incredible Hotel
reviews.text: We were originally booked to stay at the Olivia Plaza, but upon arrival told that there was a problem with our room and an alternative hotel would be found. We were initially disappointed with this news and on the short walk around Playa de Catalunya the desk manager tried to ease our irritation by insisting the hotel we were going to was better. He was NOT wrong! The Hotel Pulitzer is a wonderful hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I have stayed in numerous 4/5 hotels throughout europe, but never had the kind of personal and friendly service we enjoyed at this hotel. The hotel is well laid out with an adequate reception area leading onto both the main restaurant and bar with a central full height atrium over the latter. The service in both the restaurant and bar was excellent.
reviews.title: Briallant hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel strictly off of the reviews on Trip Advisor so I had pretty high expectations. I have stayed in several different hotels throughout Europe so I am well aware of the fact that most rooms are small in comparison to American standards. In our particular room, there was a huge column in the middle of the room making it even tinier that it already was! The bed was extremely uncomfortable to the point where neither my husband nor I felt that we had even one good night's sleep during our four night stay.
reviews.title: Great Location, Uncomfortable Beds!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the other hand, the bar in the main lobby served FABULOUSLY deliciously made drinks. The bartenders really took their time to create perfection (it made the price worth while!). The location of the actual hotel was also great. Shopping galore was within walking distance and a train station was nearby.
reviews.title: Delightful downtown digs in need of a make-over

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based on a 7-night stay:
reviews.title: Location+ comfortable and chic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011
reviews.text: PROS: 1-Great location, as noted elsewhere; within steps of Plaza Catalunya --and the final stop of the superb (it runs every 5 mins. from dawn to night) airport bus service--, the heart of BCN but on a very quiet side street. 2-Refreshing boutique-ish decor and compact yet comfortable rooms with modern bathroom and plenty of amenities. Excellent beds and powerful a/c. 3-Courteous, cheerful staff. 4-Bountiful breakfast in airy surroundings, incl. shady patio (weather permitting).
reviews.title: Great location, good value, smallish rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: CONS: 1-Is showing some age; rugs on floors (we were on the 4th) show stains and wear, paint shows wear at front door, hallway corners, etc. 2-Variable Wi-Fi coverage (v. good in bar and dining room, useless in our room).
reviews.title: This should be in the top 10 Barcelona hotels!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved everything about the Pulitzer. We made two separate visits during our trip to Spain. Both rooms were beautiful, the staff was helpful, all services worked according to plan, the restaurant and bar were excellent. The rooms were (in our opinion, but we're from SF) spacious, particularly the bathrooms. An extra bonus point for geeks out there: the WiFi service actually worked -- at all times!
reviews.title: An excellent hotel - perfect for a Barcelona stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location made it easy to get around Barcelona, being a 2 minute walk to the Metro, and/or providing easy cab access. It is refreshing to see an expensive hotel actually meet or exceed all expectations. This hotel would be our first choice if we returned to Barcelona, and we highly recommend it to anyone visiting the city.
reviews.title: A fine experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was nicely appointed with very nice linens and very clean. The "stone" bathroom sink and floor looked a little tired and were the only parts of the room that needed attention. The desk staff was excellent. The lobby lounge was beautiful. The location is outstanding: one block to Aerobus and one block to La Rambla, both of which touch the Plaza Catalunya.
reviews.title: Good, but very noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: I booked the Pulitzer based on Trip ratings, and while many aspects of the hotel were in fact as described there was a big issue for someone that was looking for a long weekend with no kids crying and awaking up in the middle of the night
reviews.title: Great Location, very modern

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We booked the romantic package. At check in we kindly asked if we could get a quiet room, we were told by Andrea that the room was quiet, but it wasn't... the 102 room in the 1st floor was right over the hotel bar so you can imagine the noise at night. On top of that the vaccum cleaner used in the morning is sufficiently power to wake up all guests in the flooor it is being used...
reviews.title: Good Location, Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed at the Pulitzer for 2 nights at the beginning of August with our 3 teenage children. We booked because of the great reviews on TA so I just wanted to write in and say it really was as great as everyone says it is. We had 3 lovely rooms next door to each other with views of the street. We all loved the smart modern decor and everyone slept really well. We ate in the restaurant both nights and the food was very good - the breakfast had plenty of choice too. The reception staff were very helpful and ordered 5 seater taxis for us (most taxis only seat 4) and the location of the hotel was perfect for sightseeing.
reviews.title: Loved the Pulitzer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have told all our family and friends what a lovely hotel it is and we would stay again.
reviews.title: Fabulous, Fabulous, Fabulous!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I can not say enough about Hotel Pulitzer. It was perfect in everyway.
reviews.title: A Strong Recomendation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The room was stylish, clean and quiet. The beds were comfortable. The location was central and had easy access to all of the tourist attractions. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The roof top terrace was extremely nice and a great place to grab a drink and the end of the day.
reviews.title: Expectations exceeded

likes.liked: — The attention to detail by the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As well, don't miss the restaurant. We ended up there after getting lost going to another place. The steak was one the best meals that I had on the entire trip.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel Pulitzer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a weekend break in Barcelona and an excellent stay at Hotel Pulitzer. Situated just off Plaça de Catalunya and therefore La Rambla, the hotel is an excellent central base for a stay in Barcelona. We took the train from Barcelona airport, using a bargain T-10 ticket to get us there - costs less than 9 Euro and as the name suggests, allows you 10 journeys within a given zone. Two people can use one at the same time, so even if you just used it to get to and from the airport, it's the cheapest way of getting to the city centre. You can use it on the Metro as well.
reviews.title: Contemporary Design & Super Central Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We got off the train at Passeig de Gracia and walked to the hotel. Took approx 10 mins and allowed us to get stuck into Barcelona straight away! Received well at the hotel and although our room wasn't available immediately, this didn't matter. We left our luggage and went for lunch at Can Paixano. A crazy experience but worth finding!
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Back at the hotel we checked into our room, second floor overlooking the street. A nice room, quite long but not particularly wide. Very spacious with high ceilings and a modern, contemporary design. Bed was very comfortable. Nice touch in the bathroom are the 'Man' and 'Woman' boxes. They contain things like a razor, aftershave balm, toothbrush and toothpaste. Great if you forgot something (although plenty of supermarkets nearby). Room also has things like a safe, minibar, flat screen TV and dimmable lights.
reviews.title: Ultra Modern Hotel with Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Never used any of the other facilities at the hotel so difficult to comment on them. The bar and dining area all looked nice and well-presented though.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel for us
Lovely stay at the Pulitzer
reviews.text: On check-out we left our bags with reception (who were excellent on every occasion). They were happy to look after them for most of the day. Overall a very good stay and well worth the money paid (you should book well in advance for the best rate). Recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: My daughter and I flew to Barcelona from London for the Springsteen concert. We arranged our stay at the Hotel Pulitzer after positive reviews on Trip Advisor. We were not disappointed. Our flight was late arriving and we went almost directly from the airport to the concert, just stopping by the hotel to register and drop off luggage. English is widely spoken with the hotel staff and they were very helpful to us. The rooms are lovely, modern and minimalist. We would have liked to have had more ability to adjust our A/C, but were completely satisfied with this hotel and would stay there again without hesitation. The location was absolutely great!
reviews.title: Excellent hotel in great location!

likes.liked: — location and appearance of the room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights on vacation. This is a well run comfortable hotel with a great location. Breakfast was included, selection was satisfactory and the presentation inpacable. The room is fair, clean and free wireless internet is provided.
reviews.title: fair value, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I've just arrived back from a long weekend in Barcelona and I definitely recommend this hotel. You couldn't ask for a better location. The lobby and bar were beautiful, but the roof top bar was my favouite- I didn't want to leave it! We found the staff extremely friendly and helpful. A friend joined us a day after we arrived and we both managed to get checked in at 12 o'clock. The staff were able to provide great advice and the bar staff were friendly and fun. The rooms were lovely, exactly the size one would expect from a European city, with loads of nice touches in the bathroom, and very comfortable beds. We were on the first floor, and there was a door somewhere that kept slamming closed which woke us up a lot, but I could live with that. I didn't try the breakfast, but I've been told it was great. Overall, I loved the hotel, I'd certainly stay in it if I return to Barcelona.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Based on previous reviews, I had high expectations for this hotel, but have to admit, similar to the previous review, that I was somewhat disappointed with this hotel. The lobby area, dining room and roof-top bar are all very nice, but the rooms are very small! We had even decided to book the 'superior room' as we knew that the rooms were small, but it also was very narrow and the only difference between this room and the standard room appeared to be the addition of a small couch. The width of the room, however, appeared to be similar, which me feel quite claustrophobic. As previously noted, there was little space to get by the t.v. on the wall to the desk area (you actually had to duck down to get by), and the sitting area by the desk was also quite cramped. We did have a small balcony, but couldn't figure out how to open the door. Similar to the previous reviewer, we were given no instructions on the room when our luggage was brought up.
reviews.title: Somewhat disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We also arrived from overseas around 11 am and were told that because other guests in the room wouldn't be checking out until noon that the room wouldn't be ready until around 2 (or possibly 1 at the earliest). We checked our luggage and tried to entertain ourselves, but after an hour of walking around returned to the lobby in the hopes that we could get into the room early. After listening to rather annoying new wave music for nearly 2 hours, we were finally let into our room at 1:55 pm. I have to admit that I was quite disappointed that no efforts were made to attend to our room to accommodate the fact that we had been traveling all night to get to Barcelona.
reviews.title: Loved EVERYTHING about Hotel Pulitzer

likes.disliked: — Refrigerator placed in the clothes closet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found this hotel through Mr & Mrs Smith - increasingly my bible for finding quirky, individual and stylish places without having to pay a fortune. This didn't disappoint. The location was great. Central, and about 15 minutes walk only to the Gothic Quarter, La Ribera and El Raval only slightly more. The rooms here (we had a standard) were small but stylishly done, with a generous size bathroom and great power shower. The downside for us is that we ended up in a smoking room despite (I thought) having asked for non-smoking. This is really a negative as the smell of smoke was incredibly strong and unpleasant so if you are a non-smoker i'd really really advise making very sure that you have a non-smoking room booked before you go.
reviews.title: Definitely worth staying here

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: Having said that it didn't take too much away from the staff. The lobby and hotel bar were very funky and the staff were great, really keen to help and make suggestions. I;d take any restaurant suggestions with a pinch of salt however. There are so many great places out there that if the one you want to go to is booked, you are better just wandering round and settling on somewhere that appeals. the one time the hotel booked for us we ended up in somewhere where the food was good but the ambience was non-existent and it wasn't cheap. We had far better meals in all others restaurants on our stay.
reviews.title: Expected more

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: To summarise, this hotel is very low-key chic, very central, stylish and reasonable with friendly staff. I'd definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Won't stay anywhere else in Barceona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I loved the location of Hotel Pulitzer. It was walking distance to nearly everything and just far enough from Las Ramblas to be reasonably quiet. I liked the contemporary decor in the lobby and restaurant, but I found the rooms modern to the point of being sparse. In addition, a minimalist look may work if the building is in pristine condition, but I found our room and the hallways rather worn looking. The front desk staff was helpful, but they often seemed understaffed. In short, I was disappointed and will look elsewhere next time I am in Barcelona.
reviews.title: Superb location and excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: I've been to Barcelona a few times, and I always make a point of staying near Plaça Catalunya because for me that's the perfect location to explore all that this unrivalled city has to offer. I'm glad that I have found this great gem of a hotel just a few steps from the square.
reviews.title: Get the suite with balcony

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived Sunday after an early morning flight and a busy Saturday night for the hotel, so as we expected we were not able to check in. We were provided with a map of the city, and we checked our luggage. Unfortunately it was raining, we were exhausted and with little else to do on a Sunday AM we sat in the lobby/lounge for about an hour waiting out the rain. Returned to the hotel at 1 and were told our room was ready. We were brought up to a room right off the elevator, which normally I would have asked to switch from, but we were so exhausted we looked forward to a nap. The bellman brought our luggage behind us, but provided no introduction to the room. Maybe its because we were tired but it took us a minute to figure out the bathroom door was a slider, and that the safe was inside the desk. We pulled the drapes for a nap, and there were little pinprick holes throughout them that let in light; I'm not thinking these were intentional. So much for the soundproof rooms...housekeeping was so noisy right outside our room all afternoon, and there was noise from the street outside, so we were unable to sleep. Then at 7, there was a knock on the door with our cava (we booked the romantic package); apparently room service did not see the do not disturb sign (he did apologize), but we finally gave up trying to sleep. The front desk provided us with a very good recommendation for tapas, and we headed out to enjoy the city. We enjoyed a drink in the hotel's rooftop bar, which is worth a stop, and the bartender was very informative and nice to talk to.
reviews.title: Not the luxury expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: The room was very narrow, as noted by other reviewers, and the bathroom tile was stained to the point that my husband thought it hadn't been cleaned in a while. The breakfast provided a good selection, but all the hot food was cold because they didn't use warmers. All in all, our stay was not up to the level we expected with this hotel being rated "best luxury in Barcelona". We stayed at another hotel upon our return to Barcelona a week later, right on Las Ramblas, and found it nicer, a little less expensive and it was actually quieter despite the location.
reviews.title: Friendly hotel - great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have just returned from a short break at Hotel Pulitzer. I enjoyed every aspect of the hotel - great breakfasts, friendly staff and clean chic room. Corridor carpets need upgrading - they are now looking a little shabby in comparison with the rest of the hotel. I will return - but I would like to be at a higher level away from the street noise next time.
reviews.title: stylish but no substance

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bet Davies, Cardiff
reviews.title: Room to Improve

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Pulitzer is well located and stylish - as it should be for the price
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, very close to La Rambla and the Barri Gothic. Had a similar experience to other comments below. Room was not ready by 2 PM as promised earlier, but we were immediately offered free drinks, and the additional wait was about 20 minutes, so we were happy. The room is not really big, but very well decorated in a modern style. There is a great TV, but easy to bump your head against it ... The bed is very comfortable
reviews.title: Highly recomended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our barman, Ale's attitude, cited elsewhere as a concern, was great with us.
reviews.title: Can't go wrong

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everyone was very helpful, location is unbeatable, it's a medium-sized property, would greatly recommend it.
reviews.title: Absolutely fabulous hotel and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those looking at hotels in this price range let me put to rest, this is the hotel to choose. Outstanding in every area, this small hotel exceeded our expectations. Service, rooms, atmosphere, food and location - one cannot go wrong.
reviews.title: Terrific staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I spent time looking for hotels in Barcelona and finally rested with the Hotel Pulitzer because of the reviews on this site and the location. It took us no time to jump onto the Metro, which is a 2 min walk from the hotel, and if you really want to see Barcelona the Metro is the way to go - easy and efficient. But what makes the hotel is the service, the people at the front desk are pleasant and always helpful. Their restaurant recommendations are generally very good and their knowledge of their city is excellent..
reviews.title: Mind your head!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the Pulitzer on a short city break. The hotel was in a brilliant central location but was quiet and peaceful despite being near the amenities. The decor was fabulous and the room very nicely done. I would definitely come back if I ever visit Barcelona again. The General Manager of the hotel is very hands-on and clearly cares about the hotel and its guests a great deal. Top marks!
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just got back from a week in Barcelona - what a fantastic city to visit. We stayed in Pultizer hotel and have to recommend it highly. Firstly the location is ideal for touring the city. Easy access to most main attractions including Las Ramblas (which I think is slightly over rated). We got a run through best places to visit (and places to avoid) from a very helpful porter. The hotel was clean but does need a freshen up of paint in places. We had a room to the front of the hotel with a small balcony. The room had everything we needed and was very comfortable. There is a nice bar on the ground floor and also a roof top bar. Both are nice and relaxed and worth a visit. Our only disappointment is the price of breakfast (not included in room price) 15 euro each which is a bit steep, especially with so many little cafe's around the corner. But overall a great experience at this hotel and we will be returning on our next trip to Barcelona.
reviews.title: Great Hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The best hotel in town!
reviews.title: No place like Pulitzer!

likes.liked: — the quettness with a central situation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We were there for a romantic break, and everything was incredible:
reviews.title: Highly recommended hotel
Lovely Boutique Hotel
reviews.text: the staff was sooo friendly! Always a smile a word...!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We arrived at the hotel and were greeted by a warm smile and very helpful receptionist who spoke excellent English. After checking our booking and explaining where the restaurant etc was for breakfast, we were given a map of the city and a book containing details of restaurants, bars and things to see.
reviews.title: pleased with the pulitzer

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: The reception and bar area were spotlessly clean and very stylish and a cool haven from the hustle and heat of outside. Our room was just as nice. We knew from reading previous reviews that the rooms were not big but to be honest it may have been smaller than some but was beautifully decorated in neutral shades, had comfy beds, plenty of wardrobe space and a lovely bathroom with bathrobes, slippers and toiletries. All of the staff we met were helpful and friendly with none of the stuffiness you sometimes experience in city centre hotels. I will be recommending this hotel to everyone i know and will definately stay here on my next trip to Barcelona.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Had a great stay at this hotel. It was located near but not on the Placa Catalunya and La Rambla, so not loud yet very convenient. Breakfast buffet was nice, and you could eat outside on the patio which was great. I had read that some of the rooms were loud, so we called ahead and got a room on the 4th floor not overlooking the central courtyard so it wasnt noisy. I had also read that the rooms were small, but I didnt find that - the room was long and narrow as opposed to square, and the bathroom was also large.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple

reviews.text: 2. Polite staff. The staff were all helpful and very charming, even when I was peppering them with dumb questions. I really admired that when my wife and I were waiting on the sidewalk outside of the hotel, for a friend to pick us up in a rented car, the security guy on duty made it a point to stand near us whenever suspicious characters came walking down the street.

description: The Hotel Pulitzer is located right in the city centre of Barcelona, just a few minutes away from the historical Ramblas and less than 5 minutes from Paseo de Gracia. It is an outstanding spot and, above all, very welcoming. Outside, it is located in the city centre of Gaudí, surrounded by culture, museums and shopping possibilities, and, inside, the black, white, rich wood, leather and glazed areas create a variety of surroundings with a welcoming and cosmopolitan atmosphere.
